AVSEC ORDER  06 / 2001 
 
SUB :  
PREVENT WEAPONS, AMMUNITIONS, EXPLOSIVES / 
EXPLOSIVE DEVICES OR ANY OTHER DANGEROUS 
DEVICES WHICH MAY BE USED TO COMMIT AN ACT OF 
UNLAWFUL INTERFERENCE 
 
 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 
1934 (XXII of 1934) delegated to him by the Central Government vide the 
Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation notification number S.O. 1797, 
dated the 3rd July, 1997, the Commissioner of the Security, Civil Aviation, for the 
purpose of security of the aircraft operations, directs that: - 
 
i) 
In order to prevent weapons, ammunitions, explosives / explosive 
devices or any other dangerous devices which may be used to 
commit an act of unlawful interference, the carriage or bearing of 
which is not authorized from being introduced, by any means 
whatsoever in the airports engaged for civil aviation operations, no 
passenger, visitor, employee or any person, other than the persons 
exempted from pre-embarkation security check on approval of 
Government of India vide this Bureau Circular No.17/98 dated  
07.08.1998, shall be allowed to gain entry into any civil airport in 
India, unless he or she is frisked and his / her belongings are 
checked by security persons at entry gate of the airport.  This shall 
be enforced with immediate effect. 
 
ii) 
Necessary equipment for security check at the entry points of 
airport terminal buildings at all the civil airports in India shall be 
installed by the concerned Airport Operator within a fortnight.  Till 
such time frisking of persons and checking of their baggage shall 
be done manually by security persons. 
 
 (VEERANNA AIVALLI) 
COMMISSIONER OF SECURITY (CIVIL AVIATION) 
 
( REF :NO.CAS-7(2)/99/Div-I 
Dated 14.09.2001)
